p: The results of the radical scavenging and antioxidative activities are given in Table 4. In the β-carotene-bleaching model system, the three Plectranthus essential oils showed variable powers to inhibit the β-carotene bleaching at a concentration of 1000 μg/mL with total antioxidative values of 71, 52 and 62% for P. cylindraceus, P. asirensis and P. barbatus respectively (Table 4). In addition, the results of the DPPH radical scavenging method exhibited a strong free radical scavenging activity for the essential oil of P. cylindraceus at the highest concentration 1000 μg/mL (75%) followed by P. barbatus and P. asirensis which showed 68 and 55% respectively (Table 4).
